title: What are the Hyperborean Symbols and what do they represent in different cultures, including ancient Italy and Roman civilization?
first_phrase: In the previous section, the author discussed various Hyperborean symbols and their significance in ancient traditions. Now, we delve into the medieval era, where these symbols continued to persist through northern British traditions. The mention of King Arthur and the Grail legend, both rooted in Hyperborean heritage, is highlighted, along with the character of "re-pescatore", who draws significance from the symbolism of the fish. Other symbols such as the swastika, axe, boar, and bear are also discussed.
content: La « terra del cinghiale » o la « terra dell'orso » sono nomi che, in quella tradi zione, stanno in relazione col termine Vareilia o 17"drcibi corrispondente proprio a quello classico di borea, donde venne l'espressione « iperboreo ». Si noti che un simbo lismo del genere si mantenne fino al Medioevo, pel tra mite della tradizione nordico-britannica. Arthur rimanda al termine greco arcthos, che vuole appunto dire « orso », e al suo regno furono dati i caratteri « po lari » e sacrali comuni a tutte le imagini del centro su premo primordiale. Una misteriosa designazione del re del Graal è quello di « re-pescatore », da spiegarsi essa stessa sulla base del simbolismo, di origine iperborea, del pesce.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the legacy of the Hyperborean tradition remains shrouded in mystery, yet its influence can be seen in the symbols and signs found throughout ancient Italy, the Roman Empire, and medieval Britain. Whether through the bear, fish, wolf, or other sacred creatures, the symbolism of the Hyperborean legacy continues to fascinate and inform those who seek to understand the secrets of our ancient past.
